Correction was made for the winner for DUN Lepar (Pahang)

Corrections were made for rejected votes for following Perak DUNs (Temengor, Selama, Alor Pongsu, Pokok Assam, Aulong, Chenderoh, Canning, Kepayang, Buntong, Manong, Keranji, Tualang Sekah, Kampong Gajah, Pasir Panjang) and Pahang DUNs (Jelai, Batu Talam ,Tras, Pulau Tawar,Kerdau)
Correction was made for PAS candidate gender for DUN Kenering (Perak)
Correction was made for all caandidate votes for DUN Jelai (Pahang)
Correction was made for all candidate votes for DUN Pulau Tawar with exception of no change for Pejuang (Pahang)
Correction was made for PRM candidate gender for DUN Lanchang (Pahang)
Corrections and updates made on 12/2/2024 for Candidate Age of selected parties and corrections were made for party allocation under Gerakan Tanah Air (GTA)
Corrections were made on 17/2/2024 to fix the abbreviation for Parti Amanah Negara
Updating column attribute headings and metadata was corrected on 5/11/2024

At the start of Nomination Day, there were 59 women ADUN candidates. With the passing of original PAS candidate for Tioman, the new replacement for PAS was woman candidate. For the whole DUN elections for GE15, 60 women ADUN candidates contested

The difference between the highest valid votes and second highest valid votes
Proportion of Total Ballots Issued as a share of Total Electorate
Total number of ballot papers issued at the poll (as in A in all Form 14 + A in Form 15)
Total number of ballot papers issued but not put in the ballot box (as in D in all Form 14) and not returned (as in D in Form 15) (B-C-D)
Total number of rejected ballot papers (as in C in all Form 14 + C in Form 15)
Total number of votes by electors
